title: Maintaining Trust Under Stress
content: Stress tests trust. Under pressure, people may revert to self-protective behaviors: blame, withdrawal, hoarding information. Teams that maintain trust under stress have practiced it and built reserves. Trust invested in good times pays dividends in bad times.

mcq.question: During a crisis, a team that usually trusts each other starts finger-pointing. What's happening?

options.B: Stress overwhelmed their practiced behaviorsâ€”they need to reset
options.D: Some blame is appropriate in crisis

mcq.explanation: Stress degrades all behaviors, including trust. The solution is recognizing it and deliberately resetting. 'We're pointing fingers. Let's refocus on solving the problem.' Teams can recover if they catch the regression.
